scope="row" rowspan="2" | Maurice "Rocket" Richard Trophy |rowspan="2" | Most goals in the regular season |rowspan="2" | || |rowspan="2" | |- | |} ==All-Stars== ===NHL First and Second Team All-Stars=== The NHL First and Second Team All-Stars consists of the top players at each position as voted on by the Professional Hockey Writers' Association.2014–15 NHL Official Guide & Record Book, p. 230–32 {| class="wikitable sortable" width="75%" |+ Florida Panthers selected to the NHL First and Second Team All-Stars ! scope="col" |Player ! scope="col" |Position ! scope="col" |Selections ! scope="col" |Season ! scope="col" |Team |- ! scope="row" rowspan="2"| |rowspan="2" | |rowspan="2" |2 | |2nd |- | |2nd |- ! scope="row" | | |1 | |2nd |- ! scope="row" | | |1 | |2nd |} ===NHL All-Rookie Team=== The NHL All-Rookie Team consists of the top rookies at each position as voted on by the Professional Hockey Writers' Association.2014–15 NHL Official Guide & Record Book, p. 233 {| class="wikitable sortable" width="75%" |+ Florida Panthers selected to the NHL All-Rookie Team ! scope="col" |Player ! scope="col" |Position ! scope="col" |Season |- ! scope="row" | | | |- ! scope="row" | | | |- ! scope="row" | | | |- ! scope="row" | | | |- ! scope="row" | | | |} ===All-Star Game selections=== The National Hockey League All-Star Game is a mid-season exhibition game held annually between many of the top players of each season. Twenty All-Star Games have been held since the Panthers entered the league in 1993, with at least one player chosen to represent the Panthers in each year except 1998 and 2011. The All-Star game has not been held in various years: 1979 and 1987 due to the 1979 Challenge Cup and Rendez-vous '87 series between the NHL and the Soviet national team, respectively, 1995, 2005, and 2013 as a result of labor stoppages, and 2006, 2010, and 2014 because of the Winter Olympic Games. Florida has hosted one of the games. The 53rd took place at the BB&T; Center, then known as the Office Depot Center. * Selected by fan vote * All-Star Game Most Valuable Player2014–15 NHL Official Guide & Record Book, p. 234 {| class="wikitable sortable" width="75%" |+Florida Panthers players and coaches selected to the All-Star GameFlorida Panthers 14–15 Media Guide. p.178 |- !scope="col" | Game !scope="col" | Year !scope="col" | Name !scope="col" | Position !scope="col" class="unsortable"| References |- ! scope="row" | 65th |2020 | | | |} ==Career achievements== ===Hockey Hall of Fame=== The following is a list of Florida Panthers who have been enshrined in the Hockey Hall of Fame. {| class="wikitable sortable" width="75%" |+Florida Panthers inducted into the Hockey Hall of Fame ! scope="col" |Individual ! scope="col" |Category ! scope="col" |Year inducted ! scope="col" |Years with Panthers in category ! scope="col" class="unsortable" |References |- ! scope="row" | |Player |2011 |2006–2007 |, retrieved June 30, 2015 |- ! scope="col" |Individual ! scope="col" |Year inducted ! scope="col" |Years with Panthers ! scope="col" class="unsortable" |References |- ! scope="row" | |2019 |2013–2014 | |- ! scope="row" | |2007 |1993–1998 | |} ===Retired numbers=== The Florida Panthers have retired three of their jersey numbers. The number 93 was retired for Bill Torrey, who was President of the team from 1993 through 2001,Florida Panthers 14–15 Media Guide, p.14 and the number 37 was retired for Wayne Huizenga, who was owner of the team from 1993 through 2001. Also out of circulation is the number 99 which was retired league-wide for Wayne Gretzky on February 6, 2000. Gretzky did not play for the Panthers during his 20-year NHL career and no Panthers player had ever worn the number 99 prior to its retirement. {| class="wikitable sortable" width="75%" |+Florida Panthers retired numbers ! scope="col" |Number ! scope="col" |Player ! scope="col" |Position ! scope="col" |Years with Panthers as a player ! scope="col" |Date of retirement ceremony ! scope="col" class="unsortable" |References |- ! scope="row" |1 | | |2000–2006, 2014–2019 |March 7, 2020 | |- ! scope="row" |37 | | |N/A |January 19, 2018 | |- ! scope="row" |93 | | |N/A |October 23, 2010 | |} ==Other awards== {| class="wikitable sortable" width="75%" |+ Florida Panthers who have received non-NHL awards ! scope="col" |Award ! scope="col" class="unsortable" |Description ! scope="col" |Winner ! scope="col" |Season ! scope="col" class="unsortable" |References |- ! scope="row" rowspan="2"|Golden Hockey Stick |rowspan="2"|Best Czech ice hockey player | | |rowspan="2"| |- | | |} ==See also== *List of National Hockey League awards ==Notes== ==References== Florida Panthers Award Winners
